avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed in high elevations after continuous SW and N winds, especially in gullies. Older snow is considered stable. Beware of terrain traps.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are widely found, especially in high elevations after continuous SW- and N- winds. Snow is widely wind packed and ice layers can be found in the snowpack. Stability test showed no response. Older snow is considered stable but beware of terrain traps.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðanátt á þriðjudag en snýr í sunnanáttir á miðvikudag og fimmtudag og úrkomulaust. Kalt í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small collapses have been seen in W-facing hills this weekend. Two avalanches released in Súðavíkurhlíð on 6.2. in NW winds, one of them closed the road. Two avalanches fell on and right by the same road early on 3.2. after ongoing SW winds.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects. Observations indicate multiple weak layers in the snowpack and increased likelihood of human triggered avalanches. Compressions tests in the area gave a sudden collapse with medium load. NE snowfall is expected for Monday and snow could drift considerably towards S facing hills.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects and weaknesses have been found between layers. Snow pits in the area from the 7th, 8th and 10th of February confirm this and compression tests have given a sudden collapse at 10-40 cm depth. Even though there is still rather little snow in mountains for the season, people travelling in steep terrain should be careful. There is an increased risk of human triggered avalanches that can be dangerous. In the cold weather, weak layers might have evolved even further due to a high temperature gradient in the snow and growth of facets.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Minnkandi N-átt á þriðjudag. SV- og V-átt og snjókoma á miðvikudag. Hægur vindur og úrkomulítið á fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A 40 m wide and up to 1 m thick slab was triggered by a snowmobile in a steep S-facing hill 10.2. An avalanche was spotted in Auðnahyrna 8.2, probably from 7th of Feb. An avalanche was spotted in Skarðsdalsvik 7.2. on a west facing slope. A slab avalanche was spotted on Tuesday morning 7.2. in a south facing gully in Bakkadalur. A slab avalanche fell over the road Ólafsfjarðarvegur on Tuesday afternoon, 6.2, east facing. Earlier the same morning, an avalanche released in Ólafsfjarðarmúli, but it was smaller and stopped above the road. A few slab avalanches were recorded early last weekend in various aspects, above Ólafsfjarðarvegur, in Dýjadalur, Tungudalur and Burstabrekkudalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: About 40 m wide slab was triggered 10.2. in a steep S-facing hill in Upsadalur close to Dalvík. Unstable windslabs should be expected after snowfall in northerly winds last week. New slabs expected in strong NE- and later N-winds with snowfall until Tuesday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New windslabs formed in NE and N wind and snowfall on Tuesday that can be unstable. Temperature by sea level is around freezing point and therefore chance of wetter snow in lower elevations. Unstable wind slabs can be found in S aspects after N wind last week and older windslabs in northerly aspects. A snow pit in Skarðsdalur 7.2. showed a layered snowpack. CT gave a collapse in the new snow at medium load. Deep in the snowpack was a weak layer with facets from the new year. ECTP17 with planar fracture between a hard slab and the firn below in Vatnsendahnjúkur W-face in Héðinsfjörður 11.2 and some whumps noticed. Whumps also in Karlsárdalur and the sledge triggered slab in Upsadalur 10.2. show that persistent windslabs can be tricky.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Dregur úr N-átt og snjókomu á þriðjudag og en gengur svo í hvassa SV-átt en úrkomulaust fram á kvöld. Líkur á snjókomu um tíma á fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small avalanche in inner Bræðslugjá by Neskaupstaður from 7th or 8th of February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger is in effect in the Eastfjords. Much snow has been added since Sunday evening, especially around Seyðisfjörður, but less in other fjords. Windslabs in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers 5 days ago. New slabs expected in strong NE- and NNW-winds until Tuesday with heavy snowfall for a while.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Much snow has been added since Sunday evening, especially around Seyðisfjörður, and drifted in NE-E winds. Before were new windslabs in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers. The windslanbs may be unstable. High in mountains there are older windslabs that may be porly bonded with harder older snow. In lower part of mountains older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: NV-átt á þriðjudag og lítil úrkoma. Hæg vestlæg og síðan breytileg átt á miðvikudag og fimmtudag.
